issue.description: The WR refers a non-existing attribute "requirement_assignment.assigned_requirement.reference_protocol".

comment.description: the rule should be: WR1: EXISTS (assigned_requirement_property.reference_protocol);
updated express. xml needs to be updated.

issue.description: The WR refers a non-existing attribute "requirement_assignment.assigned_requirement.reference_protocol".

comment.description: the rule should be: WR2 : protocol_signal IN assigned_requirement_property.reference_protocol.host_functional_definition\functional_unit_usage_view.access_mechanism;
updated express. xml needs to be updated.

issue.description: The top level query used here returns Requirement_assignment, not the Requirement_view_definition.

comment.description: I don't understand what you mean by top level query. I traced the path of the query and the function and it looks ok to me. (There may be a problem with the function parameter type of requirement_asigned_item (I don't recall that it is valid to use a SELECT type in a function parameter.)) I need more specifics.

The issue was raised against the previous version of implementation, that used inline "coding" instead of function. I have reviewed the function and it looks like to be correct. I am closing this issue.
